channel.title: computer science on Dan's Software Engineering Handbook
channel.description: Recent content in computer science on Dan's Software Engineering Handbook

item.title: Type
item.description: Regarding the nature of values in computer languages. Types are a large subcategory of computer science, which are hard to summarize succinctly. How a language implements types has a broad impact on the way the language works, the underlying complexity, the feature availability.

item.title: Big O Notation
item.description: Definition. A mathematical notation, Big O is used to classify algorithmic performance in space or time requirements. Big O is used to measure the upper bound of growth, ie, worst case scenario. Reference. Wikipedia.

item.title: Algorithm
item.description: A reusable set of computer instructions in the form of code.
